sections.paragraph_title: Enquiry about Booking Hotel Room for Event

instructions.main_head_001: SECTION 1 - Questions 1 – 7.Complete the notes below. Write ONE WORD AND/ OR A NUMBER for each answer.
instructions.main_head_002: Complete the notes below. Write ONE WORD AND/OR A NUMBER for each answer.

questions.text:
Rooms
Adelphi Room
– number of people who can sit down to eat: (1) ____________
– has a gallery suitable for musicians
– can go out and see the (2) ____________ in pots on the terrace
– terrace has a view of a group of (3) ____________

Carlton Room
– number of people who can sit down to eat: 110
– has a (4) ___________
– view of the lake

Options
Master of Ceremonies:
– Can give a (5) _______while people are eating.
– Will provide (6) _______ if there are any problems.
Accommodation: in hotel rooms or (7) _______

Questions 8 – 10
What is said about using each of the following hotel facilities?
Choose THREE answers from the options below and write the correct letter A, B or C next to Questions 8-10

Availability
A Included in cost of hiring room.
B Available at extra charge.
C Not available.

Outdoor swimming pool:(8)_______
options: A Included in cost of hiring room.
A Included in cost of hiring room.
questions.correct_answer: A Included in cost of hiring room.

questions.text: Tennis courts: (10)_______
options: A Included in cost of hiring room.

instructions.main_head_002: What information does the speaker give about each of the following excursions? Choose SIX answers from the box and write the correct letter, A-H, next to Questions 11-16.

questions.text:
Questions 11-16
What information does the speaker give about each of the following excursions?
Choose SIX answers from the options below and write the correct letter A-H next to Questions 11-16

Information
A All downhill.
B Suitable for beginners.
C Only in good weather.
D Food included.
E No charge.
F Swimming possible.
G Fully booked today.
H Transport not included.

11. Dolphin watching: _______
12. Forest walk: _______
13. Cycle trip: _______
14. Local craft tour: _______
15. Observatory trip: _______
16. Horse riding: _______

Questions 17 and 18
Choose TWO letters A-E
Which TWO things does the speaker say about the attraction called Musical Favourites?
options: A You pay extra for drinks.
B You must book it in advance.
C You get a reduction if you buy two tickets.
D You can meet the performers.
E You can take part in the show.
correct_answer: B You must book it in advance.
D You can meet the performers.

questions.text:
Questions 19 and 20
Choose TWO letters A-E
Which TWO things does the speaker say about the Castle Feast?
options: A Visitors can dance after the meal.
B There is a choice of food.
D Knives and forks are not used.
E The entertainment includes horse races.
correct_answer: A Visitors can dance after the meal.
D Knives and forks are not used.

instructions.main_head_002: Choose the correct letter A, B or C.

questions.text: 21. What does Trevor find interesting about the purpose of children’s literature?
options: A the fact that authors may not realise what values they’re teaching
B the fact that literature can be entertaining and educational at the same time
C the fact that adults expect children to imitate characters in literature
questions.correct_answer: A the fact that authors may not realise what values they’re teaching

questions.text: 22. Trevor says the module about the purpose of children’s literature made him
options: A analyse some of the stories that his niece reads.
B wonder how far popularity reflects good quality.
C decide to start writing some children’s stories.
questions.correct_answer: C decide to start writing some children’s stories.

questions.text: 23. Stephanie is interested in the Pictures module because
options: A she intends to become an illustrator.
B she can remember beautiful illustrations from her childhood.
C she believes illustrations are more important than words.
questions.correct_answer: A she intends to become an illustrator.

questions.text: 24. Trevor and Stephanie agree that comics
options: B have the potential for being useful.
C discourage children from using their imagination.
questions.correct_answer: B have the potential for being useful.

questions.text: 25. With regard to books aimed at only boys or only girls, Trevor was surprised
options: A how long the distinction had gone unquestioned.
B how few books were aimed at both girls and boys.
C how many children enjoyed books intended for the opposite sex.
questions.correct_answer: B how few books were aimed at both girls and boys.

questions.text:
What comment is made about each of these stories?
Choose FIVE answers from the box and write the correct letter A-G next to Questions 26-30.
Comments
A translated into many other languages.
B hard to read.
C inspired a work in a different area of art.
D more popular than the author’s other works.
E original title refers to another book.
F started a new genre.
G unlikely topic.

Stories
26. Perrault’s fairy tales: _______
options: A translated into many other languages.
C inspired a work in a different area of art.
D more popular than the author’s other works.
E original title refers to another book.

questions.text: 27. The Swiss Family Robinson: _______
options: A translated into many other languages.
C inspired a work in a different area of art.
D more popular than the author’s other works.
E original title refers to another book.
questions.correct_answer: E original title refers to another book.

questions.text: 28. The Nutcracker and The Mouse King: _______
options: A translated into many other languages.
C inspired a work in a different area of art.
D more popular than the author’s other works.
E original title refers to another book.
questions.correct_answer: C inspired a work in a different area of art.

questions.text: 29. The Lord of the Rings: _______
options: A translated into many other languages.
C inspired a work in a different area of art.
D more popular than the author’s other works.
E original title refers to another book.
A translated into many other languages.
C inspired a work in a different area of art.
D more popular than the author’s other works.
E original title refers to another book.
